reviews.text: My wife and I together with another couple from Australia, stayed at the Veneto in Rethymno for 4 nights at the begining of September. We selected the Veneto from the internet attracted by their attractive photo's and description, and I am pleased to say our high expectations from this were exceeded.
reviews.title: "Most venerable Veneto"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Initially we were suprised that the hotel was smaller than expected and difficult to find tucked away in the ancient alleys of the old town. However, upon entering the lobby we discovered a most charming and welcoming ambiance enhanced by the 700 hundred year old architecture.
reviews.title: Best restaurant in Rethymnon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very spacious and comfortable with a high timbered ceiling, larged shuttered windows and an adequate ensuite. The air conditioning worked well when needed.
reviews.title: Almost, but not quite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What really set this hotel apart from any other we have stayed at was the staff. They were always very freindly and helpful, particularly maitre dee Fred, and Mary, mother of the owner Yannis, who prepares the absolute best traditional greek breakfast, particularly her locamadies.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and restaurant
Lovely, but beware...no onsite parking
reviews.text: We left the Veneto to join a fantastic cruise from Rethymno arround the islands and just before the boat returned to Rethymno the tour director recommended to the other passengers to call into the Veneto as it was something special to see. She was most impressed to hear we had stayed there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a great hospitality! We stayed in room 106 for 4 nights.
reviews.title: What a great hospitality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was quiet and clean. The breakfast very rich.
reviews.title: Such a nice surprise, we did not want to leave

reviews.text: The restaurant offers high quality Greek cuisine. Don’t forget to visit the stone wine cellar.
reviews.title: Somewhat underwhelming

reviews.text: Our stay in Veneto gave as the real Cretan experience we were after.
reviews.title: Great Find...

reviews.text: We ll try to come back.
reviews.title: I just keep going back

reviews.text: From the moment you walked through the gracious Venetian stone arch, you entered a world of refined beauty and charm. Hotel Veneto was exquisitely tasteful and very romantic. We stayed 3 nights but could have stayed forever. The ambience of the whole building was magnificent; our room was simple but very comfortable. We chose to dine in every night and the food and wine were superb and extraordinarily well priced - it was by far the best food we had in the whole of Greece. Our waitress, Christine, made every night a delight! Go to Rethymno to have this experience.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at Veneto was a greate time to remember. This Venetian building is absolutely gorgeous and the rooms beautifully restored and furnished, where every room is different. Our room (106) had both a balcony and a private terrace, and was roomy and clean. This room is facing the backyard, making it quiet and relaxing.
reviews.title: Unforgettable stay at Veneto

reviews.text: Located i the heart of the old town its a perfect site for those who cant stand those big hotels with mass-tourism. In Veneto you will find a hotel with "heart and soul", and just a few rooms.
reviews.title: What a delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had some dinners at the Veneto also; they cook delicious versions of Cretan & Greek traditional dishes - wery good! Pricier than a basic taverna, but worth the extra.
reviews.title: Outstanding accomodation, unique and very special

reviews.text: One of the meals was a dinner in connection of a celebration of my mother-in-laws birthday. The food was absolutely lovely with good friendly service.
reviews.title: Beautiful boutique hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at room 104. Very large room with an additional sitting room and small kitchen. Elegant design without exagerrations. Needless to mention that everytning was clean and tidy. Breakfast and all meals we experienced at Veneto was a magnificient experience. The hotel lobby is a place you can really relax and rest. There is e free wifi connection and the staff are more than hospitable. Looking forward to go back.
reviews.title: Just perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived hot and weary; having miraculously parked in the correct car park where we were given directions to the Veneto Suites. We were directed to the unexpected and pretty Courtyard for a cold glass of white wine and then shown to our large clean and airy room. The food is cooked to a high standard and the service in the restaurant is excellent - the goat was much enjoyed- three times! Note extensive wine menu. We had a thoroughly relaxing and happy time there. We thoroughly recommend the Veneto Suites
reviews.title: An Oasis in the Old Town of Rethymno Crete

reviews.text: We had the most wonderful time in Rethymon Ctete. Hotel Veneto was so much more than we were expecting. The staff were always friendly and helpful and could not do enough for you. The surroundings are beautiful and the garden was inviting and tranquil where one could sit and relax with the peaceful sound of the waterfall. The food was delicious and of a high standard which we really enjoyed. I would definitly go back to Veneto with my family so that they too can experience the hospitality and the love that we did.
reviews.title: What an amazing Jewel in the heart of Rethymnon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am the (male) half of 'Jenny and John' but I must add to Jenny's review. This is a great place with a very friendly and welcoming staff. It has a great ambiance and is full of interesting textures and objects from its long history. It is beautifully placed in the old part of Rethymno - an easy walk to the old harbour and to all the places in the old town. Like the other reviewer below we stayed in Room 106 and it was terrific. There is another room which was part of the old monastery, all in stone with arches, but it was being renovated when we were there. Also: in February, the rate was not nearly as much as suggested elsewhere on this site - we paid 70 Euros a night and it would have a bargain at twice the price. We saw the wine cellar and will definitely be coming back sometime in high season to try the restaurant. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: A lovely, warm interesting place to stay
An inspiring place to stay
reviews.text: We have just returned from three weeks in Greece and will count as a highlight the two nights we stayed in the Veneto. Travelling is about immersing yourself in the culture and beauty of other places and we found this the moment we walked into the enchanting foyer with mosaic tiled floor of this unassuming hotel. Once a monastery and parts of is dating back four hundred years, the Veneto is one of those places you wish to share with everyone but secretely hope no one else finds. I could have sat in the foyer for ages just soaking up the ambience of the fountain, subtle lighting, stone walls, and enticing entranceway to the hotel's private cellar. Our room was delightful and included our own terrace and balcony, small kitchenette, ensuite (small) and centrepiece table with a few candles. The terrace overlooked the courtyard filled with flowers and hanging baskets. The courtyard doubles as a breakfast area (included in the tarriff). As it was winter, the restaurant was closed, which gives us a great excuse for returning. Although only planning to stay one night, we returned to the Veneto two nights later (hotels on the more remote southern Crete were closed). We arrived drenched from the rain, and were given a small bottle of raki to drink while staff quickly prepared the room we had previously stayed in before. It doesn't get much better than that. It was a priviledge to stay here. Jenny and John (Australia)
